p: Processes based on combined heat and ultrasound treatments would enable reducing the amount of time and energy needed. Mart√≠nez-Sanz et al., [ 29] observed a four-fold reduction in time without affecting the yields and properties of Gelidium sesquipedale agar-based extracts. The extracts also contained proteins, polyphenols and minerals, conferring antioxidant capacity to the browned softer gels. In contrast, an alkali pre-treatment could yield almost pure agars with higher molecular weights and crystallinities and resulted in stiffer gels, but lower extraction yields.
